org.csstudio.platform.internal
Class PluginCustomizationExporter

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.internal.PluginCustomizationExporter

public final class PluginCustomizationExporter
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class for exporting preferences into a file suitable for use as pluing customization file. The exported file can for example be used as an argument to Eclipse's -pluginCustomization command line switch.

Author:
Joerg Rathlev

Constructor Detail

PluginCustomizationExporter

private PluginCustomizationExporter()
Private constructor to prevent instanciation by other classes. Creating exporter objects is encapsulated in the exportTo(OutputStream, boolean) method to prevent accidental reuse of exporter objects.

Method Detail

exportTo

public static void exportTo(java.io.OutputStream output,
                            boolean includeDefaults)
                     throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException

Exports the current preferences to the given output stream. Exports the instance and configuration scope, in a format that is suitable for use as a plugin customization file (i.e. the scope is not written into the output).

For example, if a plugin com.example.plugin is installed and has a preference called "foo" currently set to the value "bar" in the instance scope, the following line will be written into the output: 

 com.example.plugin/foo=bar

The output stream remains open after this method returns.

Parameters:
output - the output stream to write into.
includeDefaults - set this to true if preferences set to their default values should be included in the export.
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if the export fails.

export

private void export(java.io.OutputStream out,
                    boolean includeDefaults)
             throws org.osgi.service.prefs.BackingStoreException,
                    java.io.IOException
Performs the actual export.

Parameters:
out - the output stream to write the result into.

org.osgi.service.prefs.BackingStoreException

exportNode

                 throws org.osgi.service.prefs.BackingStoreException
Exports the given node.

Parameters:
preferenceNode - the node to export.
path - the given node's path as it should be exported.
Throws:
org.osgi.service.prefs.BackingStoreException
